paragraphs.body: The Southern Water Tribe Cultural Center is a building in ${link_0} owned by ${link_1}. It hosts activities related to the culture of the ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: The Southern Water Tribe Cultural Center is a building in Republic City owned by Varrick. It hosts activities related to the culture of the Southern Water Tribe.
The Southern Water Tribe Cultural Center was bombed in 171 AG.

paragraphs.body: During the ${link_0} in 171 ${link_1}, Southern Water Tribe citizens organized a peace march in support of Southern independence toward the cultural center, with a counter-protest organized by ${link_2} in support of ${link_3} ${link_4}. Despite heavy police presence, two members of the ${link_5} orchestrated a ${link_6} at the climax of the march, successfully detonating several bombs and lighting the center ablaze. ${link_7}, on duty as a police officer, attempted to capture the perpetrators, albeit without success, only retrieving the detonating device.
paragraphs.text: During the Water Tribe Civil War in 171 AG, Southern Water Tribe citizens organized a peace march in support of Southern independence toward the cultural center, with a counter-protest organized by Northerners in support of Chief Unalaq. Despite heavy police presence, two members of the Agni Kai Triad orchestrated a bombing of the center at the climax of the march, successfully detonating several bombs and lighting the center ablaze. Mako, on duty as a police officer, attempted to capture the perpetrators, albeit without success, only retrieving the detonating device.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} was present the moment the building caught fire and immediately tried to subdue the flames with water from the basin at the foot of ${link_1}'s statue, located on the square in front of the building. Her efforts were swiftly joined by the arriving fire department.
paragraphs.text: Korra was present the moment the building caught fire and immediately tried to subdue the flames with water from the basin at the foot of Sokka's statue, located on the square in front of the building. Her efforts were swiftly joined by the arriving fire department.

paragraphs.body: Mako later discovered that Varrick had masterminded the bombing as part of his plan to escalate the civil war between the North and South by drawing in the ${link_0} and profit from the increased sales of war machinery. When confronted about his actions by ${link_1}, he justified the bombing by virtue of being the owner of the building and thus having the right to detonate his own property.
paragraphs.text: Mako later discovered that Varrick had masterminded the bombing as part of his plan to escalate the civil war between the North and South by drawing in the United Republic of Nations and profit from the increased sales of war machinery. When confronted about his actions by Asami Sato, he justified the bombing by virtue of being the owner of the building and thus having the right to detonate his own property.
